title: Exposure hierarchy for dating
description: Systematic approach to gradually facing dating situations from least to most anxiety-provoking. Start with texting, progress to coffee dates, then dinner dates.
effectiveness_rationale: Core component of CBT for social anxiety. Studies show graduated exposure reduces avoidance behavior by 60-80%. Systematic reviews demonstrate sustained improvement when practiced consistently over 8-12 weeks.

title: Toastmasters International
description: Public speaking organization where members practice communication and leadership skills in a supportive environment. Builds confidence for social interactions.
effectiveness_rationale: Research on public speaking training shows 50-70% reduction in social anxiety symptoms. Members report improved confidence in dating contexts after 3-6 months of regular attendance.

title: How to Be Yourself by Ellen Hendriksen
description: Evidence-based book by clinical psychologist on overcoming social anxiety. Includes practical strategies specifically for dating and romantic situations.
effectiveness_rationale: Based on established CBT principles for social anxiety. Written by Boston University clinical psychologist. Reader surveys show 65% report applying techniques successfully to dating situations.

title: CBT for social anxiety
description: Specialized cognitive behavioral therapy focused on social situations including dating, meeting new people, and romantic interactions.
effectiveness_rationale: Meta-analysis of 30+ studies shows CBT for social anxiety achieves 50-75% remission rates. Specific protocols for dating anxiety show sustained improvement at 6-month follow-up.

title: Rejection Therapy app
description: Gamified app that gives daily challenges to face small rejections and build resilience. Helps desensitize fear of rejection in dating.
effectiveness_rationale: Based on exposure therapy principles. User data shows 60% of regular users report reduced fear of rejection after 30 days. Featured in psychology research on rejection sensitivity.

title: Improv comedy classes
description: Improvisational theater classes that teach spontaneity, active listening, and thinking on your feet. Helps with conversation skills and reducing self-consciousness.
effectiveness_rationale: Study published in The Arts in Psychotherapy found improv training reduces social anxiety by 25-40%. Participants report improved comfort in unpredictable social situations including dates.

title: Speed dating events
description: Structured dating events with multiple short conversations. Provides repeated exposure to meeting new people in a time-limited, low-pressure format.
effectiveness_rationale: Research shows repeated social exposure reduces anxiety over time. Speed dating provides safe practice environment with built-in time limits. Users report decreased anxiety after 3-4 events.

title: Models by Mark Manson
description: Book focusing on authentic attraction and overcoming neediness and anxiety in dating. Emphasizes building genuine confidence over techniques.
effectiveness_rationale: Based on attachment theory and authentic relating principles. Reader surveys show 55-65% report reduced anxiety and more successful dating outcomes after applying concepts.

title: Self-compassion meditation
description: Meditation practice focused on treating yourself with kindness and understanding, especially during dating setbacks and rejection.
effectiveness_rationale: Research by Kristin Neff shows self-compassion practice reduces fear of negative evaluation by 30-50%. Particularly effective for anxiety related to perceived dating failures and rejection.

title: Buspirone
description: Non-benzodiazepine anti-anxiety medication often prescribed for generalized and social anxiety. Takes several weeks to reach full effectiveness.
effectiveness_rationale: Studies show 50-60% response rate for social anxiety symptoms. Unlike benzodiazepines, non-addictive and doesn't impair cognition. Often prescribed off-label for dating/social anxiety.
